greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of states generated by morphism during inflation stage of paper-folding sequence.
comment: a(0), a(1), ... is the fixed point of inflation morphism 1 -> 1 3, 2 -> 2 3, 3 -> 1 4, 4 -> 2 4, starting from state 1;
b(0), b(1), ... is the image of a(n) under encoding morphism 1 -> 0, 2 -> 1, 3 -> 0, 4 -> 1.
The number-wall over the rationals (signed Hankel determinants) is apparently free from zeros.
reference: Jean-Paul Allouche and Jeffrey O. Shallit, Automatic sequences, Cambridge, 2003, sect. 5.1.6.
link: W. F. Lunnon, The number-wall algorithm: an LFSR cookbook, Journal of Integer Sequences 4 (2001), no. 1, 01.1.1.
formula: a(n) = b(2n) - 2 b(2n-1) + 3, where b(n) denotes A038189(n).
program: if n eq 0 then return 0; // alternatively,  return 1;
else while IsEven(n) do n := n div 2; end while; end if;
return n div 2 mod 2; end function;
results.author: _Fred Lunnon_, Mar 27 2018
